column5: Well, the ice finally went out of our little bay on Tuesday, so last night I decided to put the boat in and take a little tour. Boat started like it had been running yesterday and everything worked just the way it should. There is still plenty of ice out on the main body of the lake but Goose Bay is clear of ice. Water temperature seemed to be in about the 54° range for the most part. It was a short trip and I didn't get to wet a line but I am hoping to change that tonight.
Good luck Cliff. It sounds like your honey hole will be on soon  My tinny hasn't seen the water yet
hey cliff i guess i will see you soon !!! probly in a few days out on the lake !!!
You know where   By this weekend I think our secret spot should be starting to produce, we need that 58-62°. It's getting close!
yes for sure !!! i have a few other spots as well,i dont mind showing you when we see each other out there !!!
Railway running a little earlier this year Cliff? That's great news. Enjoy!
Wow, I got the boat out on Sunday... All I found was 33.8 degree water, lol.
We carp fished 42*C water yesterday...needless to say we caught nada...but what a beauty day !!!
That's good news Cliff. Let's hope this imposter Spring holds on for a couple more weeks until the real Spring arrives.
Don't worry Mike, once my boat goes in the water spring is official!!!!! Even the big guy upstairs wouldn't have the heart to pull it back on me!
I hope your right Cliff, my dock and boat just went in tonight, earliest ever...even managed a to find a few crappie.
Hey Cliff give me a shout and let me know when you want a deckhand
Is your dock in already Cliff?

Yes, well at least part of it is. We have two young collage students staying with us and one of them very kindly gave me a hand last evening and we put the first section in (enough to launch the boat LOL) The other two sections will come when the water is warmer.
